    Data Simulation from Gaussian Distribution

    simData_Gaussian.Rd

    This function simulates data with treatment and batch effects under different batch x treatment designs from Gaussian distribution using component-based and multivariate strategy.

    simData_Gaussian(
  mean.batch,
  sd.batch = 1,
  mean.trt,
  sd.trt = 1,
  noise = 0.2,
  N,
  p_total,
  p_trt_relevant,
  p_bat_relevant,
  percentage_overlap_samples = 0.5,
  percentage_overlap_variables = 0.5,
  seeds = round(runif(1, 0, 999))
)

    Arguments

    mean.batch

    Numeric, the absolute mean of two batches respectively in batch associated components.

    sd.batch

    Numeric, the variability (standard deviation) of batch effects.

    mean.trt

    Numeric, the absolute mean of two treatment groups respectively in treatment associated components.

    sd.trt

    Numeric, the variability (standard deviation) of treatment effects.

    noise

    Numeric, the variability (standard deviation) of background noise.

    N

    Integer, the number of samples.

    p_total

    Integer, the number of variables.

    p_trt_relevant

    Integer, the number of variables affected by treatment effects.

    p_bat_relevant

    Integer, the number of variables affected by batch effects.

    percentage_overlap_samples

    Numeric, in the range of \(0\) to \(1\), the percentage of samples in the first batch and first treatment group.

    percentage_overlap_variables

    Numeric, in the range of \(0\) to \(1\), the percentage of variables with both batch and treatment effects given fixed number of variables with each effect.

    seeds

    Integer. Default value is randomly selected from \(0\) to \(999\).

    Value

    simData_Gaussian returns a list that contains the following components:

    data

    The simulated data.

    cleanData

    The ground-truth data without the batch effect.

    Y.trt

    The simulated outcome variable indicating the treatment grouping information.

    Y.bat

    The simulated outcome variable indicating the batch grouping information.

    true.trt

    The variables assigned with the treatment effect.

    true.batch

    The variables assigned with the batch effect.

    tComp_relevant

    The component simulated with the treatment effect.

    bComp_relevant

    The component simulated with the batch effect.

    References

    Wang Y, Lê Cao K (2020). “A multivariate method to correct for batch effects in microbiome data.” bioRxiv.

    Author

    Yiwen Wang, Kim-Anh Lê Cao

    Examples

    ## Not run:
## First example
## Balanced batch x treatment design
simulation1 <- simData_Gaussian(mean.batch = 7,
                                sd.batch = 8,
                                mean.trt = 3,
                                sd.trt = 2,
                                N = 40,
                                p_total = 300,
                                p_trt_relevant = 60,
                                p_bat_relevant = 150,
                                percentage_overlap_samples = 0.5,
                                percentage_overlap_variables = 0.5,
                                seeds = 1)

## Second example
## Unbalanced batch x treatment design
simulation2 <- simData_Gaussian(mean.batch = 7,
                                sd.batch = 8,
                                mean.trt = 3,
                                sd.trt = 2,
                                N = 40,
                                p_total = 300,
                                p_trt_relevant = 60,
                                p_bat_relevant = 150,
                                percentage_overlap_samples = 0.2,
                                percentage_overlap_variables = 0.5,
                                seeds = 1)
## End(Not run)
